intro: Bradshawia, commonly known as the flame spike, is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its striking, bright red bracts that surround its small, yellow flowers. Bradshawia grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its foliage consists of long, narrow, dark green leaves that are arranged in a fan shape.
